## SDQ vs BSAG

Harmony emerges as a revolutionary tool, streamlining the tiresome process of questionnaire harmonisation. It primarily benefits psychologists and social scientists who often need to draw comparisons between different instruments; for instance, SDQ vs BSAG. Using Harmony's smart use of natural language processing and generative AI models, the matching of items from the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and the Bristol Social Adjustment Guide (BSAG) can be done seamlessly and accurately. Focusing on the SDQ vs BSAG comparison, these studies are often carried out to gauge behavioural screening and social adjustment in children respectively. The Harmony tool can analyze and compare each instrument's items, providing an accurate percentage match. Versatility is another key aspect of Harmony; you can either select these instruments from its extensive database or simply upload the PDF version of your own instruments. The discussion around SDQ vs BSAG lends itself to the broader importance of longitudinal studies. Harmony's prowess extends to comparisons across such studies, across multiple languages, permitting a refined analysis bolstered by changing social conditions. To those embarking on an SDQ vs BSAG comparison, or any comparison in general, Harmony promises a holistic, user-friendly experience that simplifies and enriches your research process.

## Compare the items in SDQ and BSAG

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and BSAG into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just BSAG into Harmony</a> - compare BSAG with other instruments
